newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan July department store sales down 2.4% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan July department store sales down 2.4% yr/yr.

text.p: Sales at department stores in Japan fell 2.4 percent in July from a year earlier to 898.66 billion yen, the Japan Department Stores' Association said on Monday.
It was the first fall in Japanese department store sales in seven months, the association said in a statement.
The July figure was 2.5 percent lower than in June.
The survey covered 258 outlets of 109 department store firms nationwide.
The association said the fall in sales was due to there being one less weekend in the month, low demand from corporate clients, and the effects of Japan's food-poisoning epidemic.
